There are still few commented out throws
Yep, there's still plenty to do on this patch.

Adaptor&& maybe be reference then it will be moved instead of forwarded as reference.

std::forward should stay and if we want to perform move it needs to be ensured by calling handleUpgrade with std::move eg. handleUpgrade(req, res, std::move(adaptor)); then std::forward here will forward it as r-value referece.

> Adaptor&& maybe be reference then it will be moved instead of forwarded as reference.

I suspect this was a bad merge conflict resolution.  The code that this commit was originally forked from didn't use std::forward.

> 
> std::forward should stay and if we want to perform move it needs to be ensured by calling handleUpgrade with std::move eg. handleUpgrade(req, res, std::move(adaptor)); then std::forward here will forward it as r-value referece.

ACK
This is no longer present in the latest patch.
